Straits and tho Sea of Marmo; Copy of letter from the Br^Gjlsli iH'v!i^l::Z Peace Conference^ to-the jlna^aan^ ^^^^IAjJ^-^JI^l (Circulated for information).Nototached.2, Whitehall Gardens,L 0 N D 0 N,' SJ.1. 9th April, 1920.Sir,I am directed by Mr.Lloyd George to call the attention of the Drafting Committee to my letter of 80th March, 19SO, forwarding for the information of the Drafting Committee, draft Articles on the administration of the Waterways of the Straits and the Sea of Marmora. A copy of this letter and enclosure is attached for convenience of reference. (CP.994)./*I am now directed to inform the Drafting Committee that Articles 6 and 11, which had previously been reserved^ were approved by the Council of Ambassadors and Foreign Ministers at a meeting held at the Foreign Office, London, on.Wednesday, April 7th. It was left for the Drafting Committee to fill in the blank reference to the Article and chapter in Article 11.I have the honour to be, Sir, Your obedient Servant, . (Signedf M.P.A.HAHKBY,British Secretary.The Chairman,DRAFTING COMMITTEE.
